label: noCharactersYetDescription
Value:
You don’t have a character yet.
Create one to start playing.

You can create up to 3 characters, one for each class: Warrior, Archer, and Mage.

label: dailyFlavor
Value:
Check in every day to track this habit.
Good for habits that need daily awareness, consistency, or avoidance.
Example: Avoid sugary snacks.
Completed after 90 consecutive days of positive checks.

label: weeklyFlavor
Value:
"Review your progress once per week.
Good for habits that need regular effort and flexibility
column3:
without the pressure of daily tracking.
Example: Go to the gym 3 times a week.
Completed after 12 consecutive weeks of positive checks."

label: monthlyFlavor
Value:
"Review your progress once per month.
Good for habits that need reflection
column5:
without frequent check-ins.
Example: Read one book per month.
Completed after 6 consecutive months of positive checks."

label: yearlyFlavor
Value:
"Review your progress once per year.
Good for habits focused on long-term growth
column4:
or identity.
Example: Build financial stability.
Completed after 3 consecutive years of positive checks."

label: noviceArmorDescription
Value: An unadorned robe for those taking their first steps into magic.

label: crystalsInTheForgottenMineDescription
Value:
The Fire Guild senses raw magic beneath the forgotten tunnels.
Enter the mine and collect 3 Lizard Crystals.

label: crystalsInTheForgottenMineSuccess
Value:
You descend carefully into the mine, your staff illuminating the damp stone walls.
Faint blue light flickers between cracks in the rock — raw mana crystallized by time and pressure.
A few cave critters scatter as you collect the glowing shards.
By the time you emerge, your pouch hums softly with arcane energy.
The Guild will be pleased.

label: crystalsInTheForgottenMineFailure
Value:
Deeper in the tunnels, the air grows heavy and unstable. A sudden tremor shakes loose stones from above, forcing you to retreat before the passage collapses.
You leave empty-handed, your robes covered in dust — but at least you learned which paths are unsafe.
Next time, you’ll be better prepared.

label: collapsedTunnelInvestigationDescription
Value:
The lower chambers of the mine have partially collapsed after your last visit.
The Guild believes the arcane pulse comes from beyond the sealed passage.

label: collapsedTunnelInvestigationSuccess
Value:
You return to the mine with greater caution, the memory of falling stones still fresh in your mind.
With controlled bursts of focused magic, you carefully clear unstable debris without triggering another collapse.
Beyond the rubble, a faint crystal formation glows brighter than the others — pulsing like a heartbeat.
You collect fragments for the Guild and mark the deeper path for further study.
The source of the disturbance lies further below.

label: collapsedTunnelInvestigationFailure
Value:
As you attempt to clear the blocked passage, the weakened ceiling groans ominously.
A surge of unstable mana erupts from the fractured crystals, forcing you to shield yourself and retreat.
The tunnel remains sealed, and whatever lies beyond continues to pulse in the darkness.
You will need steadier control — and stronger magic — to proceed.

label: crystalHeartGuardianDescription
Value:
Deep beneath the mine, the arcane pulse takes form.
A corrupted elemental guards the growing Crystalheart.

label: crystalHeartGuardianSuccess
Value:
The air thickens as you descend into the lowest chamber.
At its center floats a jagged mass of crystal and stone — a Crystalheart Guardian, born from unstable mana.
It lashes out in shards of glowing fragments, but your spells strike true.
With a final surge of focused power, the construct fractures and collapses into harmless crystal dust.
The chamber grows silent. The pulse weakens — but it is not yet gone.

label: crystalHeartGuardianFailure
Value:
The Crystalheart Guardian awakens fully as you enter the chamber.
Shards of crystal orbit its core, slicing through the air with violent precision.
Your spells falter against its unstable shell, and a blast of raw mana forces you back toward the tunnels.
You barely escape as the chamber trembles behind you.
The Guardian remains — stronger than expected.

label: sealTheArcaneCoreDescription
Value:
With the Guardian destroyed, the true source of the disturbance is revealed.
Descend into the ley-line chamber and seal the unstable Arcane Core.

label: sealTheArcaneCoreSuccess
Value:
Beyond the shattered remains of the Guardian lies a cavern unlike the others.
At its center floats a swirling sphere of raw, untamed mana — the Arcane Core.
The ley-line pulses violently, threatening to rupture the entire mine.
You steady your breath and channel every fragment of discipline you possess.
Runes ignite around the chamber as you weave a sealing pattern into the air.
The Core resists — then slowly contracts, its light softening to a steady glow.
The tremors cease. The mine is safe.
When you emerge beneath the open sky, you feel stronger — changed by the power you contained.

label: sealTheArcaneCoreFailure
Value:
The Arcane Core surges the moment you approach it.
Raw mana lashes outward in chaotic waves, tearing at your focus.
You attempt to bind the energy, but the ley-line fractures under the strain.
The chamber erupts in blinding light, forcing you to retreat before the collapse consumes you.
The Core remains unstable, its pulse echoing through the depths.
This will require greater mastery — and perhaps a steadier mind.

label: marshWhispersTitle
Value: Echoes in the Marsh of Whispers

label: marshWhispersDescription
Value:
Strange lights flicker above the flooded ruins beyond the village marsh.
The Fire Guild asks you to investigate the disturbance and recover any surviving texts.

label: marshWhispersSuccess
Value:
Mist coils around your boots as you step into the marshlands.
Between broken stone pillars, you find the remains of an ancient archive half-sunken in dark water.
A faint magical resonance leads you to a sealed chest preserved by old warding runes.
With careful hands, you recover a damp but intact Arcane Journal from within.
The lights fade as you leave, as if satisfied their message was heard.

label: marshWhispersFailure
Value:
The marsh shifts beneath your steps, mud swallowing your footing.
A surge of cold, stagnant mana ripples through the flooded ruins, disrupting your focus.
You search briefly, but the unstable currents make it too dangerous to continue.
The lights flicker once more in the distance before vanishing into the mist.

label: sunkenSealDescription
Value:
The recovered Arcane Journal speaks of a hidden chamber beneath the flooded ruins.
Use its notes to locate and unseal the ancient floodgate.

label: sunkenSealSuccess
Value:
Following the journal’s faded diagrams, you wade deeper into the submerged archive.
Behind a curtain of hanging roots, you uncover a circular stone mechanism etched with old warding glyphs.
You press your palm against the runes and channel a steady flow of mana, aligning the pattern described in the Arcane Journal.
The floodgate trembles before slowly grinding open, revealing a hidden vault untouched by time.
Inside, resting upon a pedestal, you find an ornate Silver Key — still humming with protective magic.

label: sunkenSealFailure
Value:
You attempt to replicate the sealing pattern described in the journal, but the runes resist your control.
The marsh water surges violently as unstable magic reacts to your interference.
A sharp pulse of energy forces you back, and the glyphs dim once more.
The floodgate remains sealed, its secrets protected for now.

label: drownedArchivistDescription
Value:
Beyond the opened floodgate lies a submerged vault untouched for centuries.
Use the Silver Key to enter and confront what guards the forbidden knowledge.

label: drownedArchivistSuccess
Value:
The Silver Key turns with a heavy click, and the vault door slowly parts, releasing a breath of cold, stagnant air.
Inside, shelves of preserved tomes float in suspended water, held aloft by ancient magic.
At the chamber’s center rises a translucent figure — the Drowned Archivist, bound to protect the knowledge within.
You weave counter-spells through the waterlogged air, unraveling the spirit’s bindings without destroying it entirely.
With a final surge of focused mana, the entity dissipates into harmless mist, leaving behind a pulsating Waterbound Sigil.
The archive is now open — but its core still trembles below.

label: drownedArchivistFailure
Value:
As the vault opens, the chamber floods with spectral light.
The Drowned Archivist awakens in full, its voice echoing like distant bells beneath water.
Your spells distort in the dense, saturated air, and the spirit’s energy surges outward in a crushing wave.
You stagger back through the doorway as the vault seals itself once more.
The guardian remains vigilant, its duty not yet fulfilled.

label: drownedCoreDescription
Value:
With the Waterbound Sigil in your possession, the final chamber beneath the archive reveals itself.
Descend into the abyss and bind the unstable Drowned Core before it consumes the marsh.

label: drownedCoreSuccess
Value:
The depths beneath the archive open into a vast submerged cavern, illuminated by a spiraling vortex of blue-white energy.
At its center churns the Drowned Core, a fusion of ley-line currents and ancient preservation magic gone awry.
You raise the Waterbound Sigil, and its markings ignite in radiant light.
Channeling every ounce of discipline, you anchor the sigil’s pattern into the swirling heart of the vortex.
The waters roar and crash against invisible barriers, but your will holds steady.
Slowly, the violent currents soften, condensing into a stable, luminous sphere.
The marsh grows quiet. The ruins no longer whisper in unrest.
You leave the depths carrying the calm of a mage who has mastered chaos.

label: drownedCoreFailure
Value:
The cavern trembles as the Drowned Core senses your presence.
You invoke the Waterbound Sigil, but the vortex surges violently, overwhelming the binding pattern.
Water and raw mana spiral together in a deafening maelstrom, shattering your focus.
With the chamber collapsing around you, you are forced to retreat before the energy consumes everything.
The Core remains unstable, its restless pulse echoing through the marshlands.
